thread.title: Brooklyn police chase causes car to crash into Cleveland bar - cleveland.com
thread.title_full: Brooklyn police chase causes car to crash into Cleveland bar - cleveland.com

title: Brooklyn police chase causes car to crash into Cleveland bar - cleveland.com
text:
Brooklyn police chase causes car to crash into Cleveland bar Cleveland police tape A Brooklyn police chase caused a vehicle to crash into a Cleveland bar Saturday night, police said. (cleveland.com file photo) comments 
CLEVELAND, Ohio - A car crashed into a Cleveland bar Saturday night during a Brooklyn police chase. 
The crash happened about 9 p.m. at a bar near Fulton Road and Memphis Avenue in the city's Old Brooklyn neighborhood, Cleveland police spokeswoman Sgt. Jennifer Ciaccia said. Brooklyn police were pursuing one vehicle at the time of the crash. 
The chased vehicle smashed into two other vehicles, pushing one into the bar, Ciaccia said. One person was injured in the incident, but it's unclear how serious the injuries were. 
The vehicle that was being chased got away from Brooklyn officers, Ciaccia said. 
Brooklyn police officials were not immediately available to say why the chase was initiated. Cleveland police only completed the crash report, Ciaccia said.
